awd_abstract_narration: Recent discoveries of new types of sulfur bacteria prompt a                revision of out thinking on the marine sulfur cycle and the role of             microbial agents in cycling.  This research will concentrate on the             reductive and oxidative transformations of elemental sulfur,                    sulfite, thiosulfate and sulfate both within and below the                      oxic/anoxic interface in the Black Sea, with comparisons of                     biological vs. chemical nature of these transformations.  The focus             on the Black Sea will take advantage of the excellent oceanographic             and geochemical background knowledge on the strong oxic/anoxic                  interface and the anoxic sediments and bottom waters.  It will also             facilitate significant collaborations on this important topic.                       Dr. Jannasch is one of the world's leading marine                          microbiologists with a strong record of productivity and major                  discovery with Foundation support.  He has already provided                     significant leadership in the initiation of the proposed Black Sea              multidisciplinary research expedition.
